alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 14 at 4:43AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS AND HIGH SURF POSSIBLE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT ALONG THE SOUTHWEST COAST... A strong low and frontal system are expected to approach the Southwest coast later this evening into tonight. Moderate snow moving in with this system will quickly switch over to rain as warm air moves in as the front passes through during the overnight tonight. Southeast winds gusting between 30 and 40 mph along the coast will become southwesterly behind the front, then persist through Wednesday evening as the low moves onshore near the Kuskokwim Delta. There is increasing confidence for the combination of gusty onshore winds and waves building as high as 10 to 20 feet away from the immediate coastline to cause high surf and possible coastal erosion for communities along the shoreline of Bristol Bay and the Kuskokwim Delta. Water levels exceeding the normal high tide line will be possible, particularly during the high tidal cycles from tonight through Wednesday night. Please visit weather.gov/afc for more information and the latest forecast updates.
